runs.comm: back of a length, around off, defended
short and wide, cut away, not very well, but gets it into the gap in front of square
inswinger, tailing in towards the off stump, worked away with the swing for one
yorker, around leg, played to fine leg for one
beauty, cuts him into two, with the sharp offcutter outside off
short ball, punched square, and Nathan McCullum at cover-point dives to his left and fields it behind his body
length ball, around, punched away for one
length ball on the pads, he ends up chipping it over the infield, and gets it bounce to deep square leg
back of a length, around off, kicks at him, he gets the bottom hand off and bunts it into the leg side for one
bouncer, Akmal sways out of the line, the umpire calls it wide for height
oversteps, back of a length, outside off, punched away to third man
full ball, around off, Butt clears the front leg and crashes it wide of mid-off
dabs this down to third man for one
Mills comes back! slower ball, loopy, outside off, Akmal goes for the big drive, gets a big inside edge onto the stumps
tucks him up, back of a length, leg-stump line, played to square leg
full, on the pads, flicked away towards fine leg
loose shot first up, pitched up outside off, holding its line, and he drives away from his body, barely missing the edge. He is not happy with the sight screen too
short ball, quick, Hafeez, stands tall, and short-arm jabs it, down the ground, and the mid-on is too wide and up, and it goes all the way for four
misses the line, angling down the leg side, and he glances it past the keeper. Subcontinent batsmen will do that all day
Bond comes back beautifully! An absolute peach. Back of a length, just outside off, holding its line and kicking at him, takes the edge as he looks to defend it. Top bowling
runs this down to third man for one

New Zealand on fire here! Digs this one in short, no room there, Umar leans back to run this down to third man, and it bounces at him, and all Umar can manage is an edge to the keeper even as he is looking to withdraw from the shot
more like shin music, full and down the leg side, wide
back of a length, around off, defended
same length, around off, Misbah stays back to defend, is beaten and is hit outside off, also the bounce is taking it over the stumps
full ball, around off, pushed to mid-off

has the umpire missed a trick here? Misbah looks to get out of this short one angled into his body, and is hit into the body and runs off the deflection. Ian Gould thinks it took some sort of wood on the way, else there is no way this should be a leg-bye
back of a length, around off, played one bounce towards slip
angled into the pads, makes no connection with it, and is hit in the thigh pad
short ball, into the ribs, is beaten as he looks to work it away
slower ball, full outside off, hit to short cover
back of a length, bounces high at him, punched to point
maiden over, superb start by Butler. Back of a length again, on middle and leg, Misbah defends
slower ball, pushed to cover
huge appeal, not given. Short ball, Butt looks to pull, and there is a sound as it passes the bottom edge of the bat. Butt seems to have had a let-off
and he rubs it in by pulling this one in front of square, sweetly timed shot
beaten outside off, lovely comeback by Mills, back of a length, fast, nipping away from him
slightly fuller, Butt defends it towards point
floated full and wide outside off, and that is exactly what Butt wants, just clears his arms at it and lofts it over point
short ball outside off, and punched away to sweeper-cover
flighted around off, punched to straightish extra cover
misfielded by Styris! Cut away by making room, square of deep point, Styris does well to to get there via  dive but the hands don't come down in time, letting it through
swept away from in front of the stumps
well bowled, well played, slows it down, just back of a length, Misbah stays back, waits, and is able to change his shot as this one comes in towards him with the arm, gets a single to midwicket
some bounce there, Butt stands tall and hits it back to the bowler

and Gould's second mistake in two overs, after missing that Butt edge! The wrong man ends up paying, though. There is an inside edge on this and he is given lbw. Back of a length, around off, nips in sharply, gets the edge onto the back pad, over the knee flap. Too much doubt to give this one, even if it hit the back leg
back of a length, worked away to midwicket, first run off Butler
fullish around off, punched to point
runs it down to third man for one
lovely shot, short and wide, and he waits and waits and opens the face the last moment, getting it fine of third man
short ball, rises high into him, chopped towards point for one
short ball, worked away wristily to long-on
full ball, swept away towards deep square
length ball outside off, flat, driven to sweeper-cover for one
short, around the pads, pulled away
good shot, cuts this short one, and cuts it square enough of deep point to come back for two
almost got him! tossed it up, Afridi was onto the front foot too early, and the chip ended on a half-volley to Vettori
angled into the hips, worked away towards fine leg
helped away to fine leg for one
dabbed away to third man for one

what a catch by Nathan McCullum. This evens out the screamer from Umar Akmal earlier in the day. Pulled towards deep midwicket, dying on him, McCullum charges in, dives full length, gets his hands under it. He also needs to adjust for the wind, because the ball suddenly seems to hold up on him: it was hit into the wind. Afridi should have stayed back and asked for the replay, this one was close to bouncing in front of him. But after two-three replays, I will venture and say it bounced in his fingers, and he then controlled it
runs this down to third man again
leaves it alone outside off
flighted around leg, defended back to him
full around off, hit to mid-off
sweeps, misses, gets a leg-bye
tossed up nicely, Razzaq stays back and defends
fired in, but down the leg side
stays back to defend this one
worked into the leg side for one
short ball, worked away for one to point
angling into the pads, helped away to short fine
turn and bounce, from round the wicket, cramping him up as he looks to open the face on it
flat on the pads, and worked away for one
swept away with the angle
defended around his pad, towards midwicket
back of a length, cramps him up with the leg-stump line
fire with fire, digs it in short, Butt stands tall and pulls this in front of square, and it flies across the outfield
almost played on, looks to run it down to third man, and the inside edge hits him in the pad, and they sneak a single
bouncer, he ducks under it, and square-leg umpire calls it a wide
slower ball, he tips and runs, towards cover
punched square of the wicket, gets a single
beauty, legcutter, holding its line outside off, Razzaq ends up playing inside the line
short ball, pulled away, wide enough of deep midwicket to let them come back for two
short again, cut to deep point this time
angled across him, gets a thick edge towards short third
sharp offbreak, pitching off and middle and turning in and beating him
defended to short midwicket, pressure building up
Razzaq is calm, dabs it for one
flat around off, pushed back to the bowler
full on the pads, and he looks to work it square on the leg side. Not looking in form here
that's how you make mockery of the form book! What a clean, clean strike! Just clears his front leg, and lofts a length ball into the second tier
fuller delivery, and another murderous strike, straight, flat and one bounce into the boundary boards
slow, very slow, Razzaq waits and waits and still can't get any power into the cut shot
beats him in the flight, and he still manages to loft it over deep midwicket. He has gone straight from first gear to top gear
pushed back to the bowler

elementary error from Butler at deep fine leg, swept away and he is beaten by the spin on the bounce. Who would have expected this from a Kiwi? Perhaps he needed Kamran Akmal to remind him "ghoomegi, ghoomegi [will turn, will turn]"
cut away but can't beat point
pulled away towards midwicket for one
shapes up for the big hit, Nathan bowls it flat, he works it into the leg side
flighted delivery, pushed down to long-off
dabs it down to third man for one
slower balls, beats his attempted straight loft
slower short ball, Razzaq backs away and is beaten on the pull. Hopkins doing well here, both of these bounced in front of him but he has his body behind it
another slower bouncer, and even as he is ducking he tries a swish at it. Top over so far
quicker short ball, Razzaq backs away again, and is beaten on the attempted cut

Razzaq is making a mockery of trends here! All over he has looked like an incompetent batsman, but makes supreme connection with this short ball, and launches it over long-on, and out of the Kensington Oval
punched to sweeper-cover for one
cut to extra cover and they sneak a sharp single
pushed down to long-off for one
close, close stumping! Razzaq slogs at a ball outside off, is beaten, his toe is on the line, but he has just slid a part of his foot back in time

and Nathan McCullum delivers the big wicket at a crucial juncture again! Shortish delivery, Razzaq pulls, but the extra bounce does him in, the top edge settles down Taylor's throat at the edge of the midwicket boundary
Butt meanwhile gets to a calm fifty, pushing this to long-on. he now has to see Pakistan through
Butt is playing a special knock here! Slower ball, picks it early, gets on a knee, and almost caresses it over wide long-off. Lovely timing
short ball, pulled down the ground to long-on
tips and runs, Styris is quick as flash at cover, swoops and flicks at the stumps even while diving, and he misses by inches. Would have got him had he hit
mis-hit, top half of the bat as he swings at this short ball, but it bounces in front of long-off
worked away off the pads, gets Butt back on the strike
pulled down the ground, Butt retains strike for the last over
bouncer, and he makes room and misses. Not even high enough to be one for the over
and Butt comes back! Length ball, and he knows third man is up and he deliberately plays it with an open face. Top shot, what a finish here
quick short ball, extra bounce, angling in, 135ks, no room, Butt is beaten, gets a stare from Butt

and Butt strikes back! charges down the pitch and cuts this short ball over point. He got the room here. Styris gives in a spirited chase from sweeper-cover, and the ball spins away from him upon bouncing. What a game

yorker, yorker, beats him as he makes room, Rehman steals a bye, Hopkins is late in going for the throw, and even though he hits the stumps direct, Rehman is in. Cheekily, after it has been referred to the third umpire, he is looking for the overthrow. Not on, sir. The ball is dead already
no we won't! Rehman gets a dream ball, length ball, angled into the pads, and he lofts it into the leg side. They run for dear life, but it has carried to deep square leg for a simple catch
